name: Absurdist Web
crafting_components: Silk of a giant spider and the soul of an ettercap
description:
When you try to unfold this bed sheet-sized knot of spidersilk, you occasionally unearth a long-dead sparrow or a cricket that waves thanks before hopping away. It's probably easier just to wad it up and stick it in your pocket. The interior of this ball of web is an extradimensional space equivalent to a 10-foot cube. To place things into this space you must push it into the web, so it cannot hold liquids or gasses. You can only retrieve items you know are inside, making it excellent for smuggling. Retrieving items takes at least 2 actions (or more for larger objects) and things like loose coins tend to get lost inside. No matter how full, the web never weighs more than a half pound.

A creature attempting to divine the contents of the web via magic must first succeed on a DC 28 Arcana check which can only be attempted once between long rests.

Any creature placed into the extradimensional space is placed into stasis for up to a month, needing no food or water but still healing at a natural pace. Dead creatures in the web do not decay. If a living creature is not freed within a month, it is shunted from the web and appears beneath a large spider web 1d6 miles away in the real world.

name: Aegis of the Eternal Moon
crafting_components: Metal that has fallen from space
description:
The circular surface of this gleaming silver shield is marked by dents and craters making it reminiscent of a full moon. While holding this medium shield, you gain a magical **+1** bonus to AC. This item has 3 charges and regains 1 charge each night at moonrise.

While this shield is equipped, you may expend 1 charge as an action to cast *moonbeam*, with the following exceptions: the spell manifests as a line of moonlight 10 feet long and 5 feet wide emanating from the shield, and you may move the beam by moving the shield (no action required). When the first charge is expended, the shield fades to the shape of a gibbous moon and loses its magical **+1** bonus to AC. When the second charge is expended, the shield fades to the shape of a crescent moon and becomes a light shield, granting only a **+1** bonus to AC. When the final charge is expended, the shield fades away completely, leaving behind its polished silver handle. When the shield regains charges, it reforms according to how many charges it has remaining.

name: Aerodite the Autumn Queen's True Name
crafting_components: Autumn leaf taken from The Dreaming
description:
This slip of parchment contains the magically bound name 'Airy Nightengale' surrounded by shifting autumn leaves. While you are attuned to it, you can use a bonus action to invoke the name on this parchment to summon a vision of a powerful archfey beside you for 1 minute. Airy acts catty and dismissive but mellows with flattery. Once a vision is summoned in this way, it cannot be summoned again for the next 24 hours.

You can use an action to verbally direct the vision to do any of the following:

- Perform minor acts of nature magic (as *druidcraft*).
- Whisper charming words to a target creature within 5 feet.

Creatures whispered to in this way must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save targets become charmed by the vision until the end of their next turn, treating the vision and you as friendly allies.

- Bestow a magical fly speed of 10 feet on a creature within 5 feet for as long as the vision remains.

Alternatively, as an action while the vision is summoned you can agree to revoke your claim on Aerodite in exchange for her direct assistance. When you do so the parchment disappears in a flurry of autumn leaves, and for the next minute the figment transforms into an alluring vision of the Dreaming at a point you choose within 60 feet (as *hypnotic pattern*, save DC 13). Once you have revoked your claim in this way, you can never invoke Aerodite's true name again.

name: Air Charm
crafting_components: Feather from a migratory bird collected on its third return home
description:
While wearing this charm you can hold your breath for an additional 10 minutes, or you can break the charm to release its power, destroying it to activate one of the following effects.

- **Flight**: Cast *fly*.
- **Float**: Cast *feather fall*.
- **Whirl**: Cast *whirlwind kick* (+7 spell attack bonus, spell save DC 15).

**Curse**. Releasing the charm's power attracts the attention of a djinni who seeks you out to request a favor.

name: Alliance Rings
crafting_components: Matching rings worn for at least a year by a cleric and a herald
description:
These matched glass rings shimmer from a stitch of eldritch energy that runs through their center. When you and another creature attune to the rings, you each gain the ability to sense your approximate distance from one another. You also receive a slight jolt when the other ring wearer drops to 0 hit points.

When the other ring wearer takes damage, you can use your reaction to concentrate and rotate the ring. When you do so, both you and the other ring wearer receive an image of an elderly herald giving up her life to shield her cleric companion from enemy arrows. The effect, spell, or weapon's damage dice are rolled twice and the lower result is used. After being used in this way, the energy in each ring disappears and they both become mundane items.

name: Amber Wings
crafting_components: Tree sap taken from The Dreaming
description: This pair of amber dragonfly wings holds the memories of a native of the Dreaming who befriended several insect companions. You can speak with insects when carrying the wings in your hand or wearing them as a piece of jewelry. When you speak the name of the fey creature whose memories lie within the wings, you briefly experience the sensation of flying atop a giant dragonfly. For 1 minute after speaking the name, you can glide up to 60 feet per round. This functions as though you have a fly speed of 60 feet, but you can only travel horizontally or on a downward slant. The wings crumble to dust after the gliding effect ends.

name: Ammunition +1, +2, or +3
crafting_components: Naturally fallen branches from a druid's grove
description: This ammunition comes in bundles of 10. When used to make a ranged weapon attack, a piece of this ammunition grants a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it: **+1** (uncommon), **+2** (rare), or **+3** (very rare). After hitting a target, a piece of ammunition loses its magical properties.

name: Amulet of Health
description: Wearing this amulet increases your Constitution score to 19. It has no effect if your Constitution is equal to or greater than 19.

name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
description: You are hidden from divination magic while wearing this amulet, including any form of scrying (magical scrying sensors are unable to perceive you).

name: Amulet of the Planes
crafting_components: Scroll of plane shift crafted by a deceased wizard
description: While wearing this amulet, as an action you can specify a location familiar to you on another plane of existence, making a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a success you cast the *plane shift* spell, but on a failure you and every creature and object within a 15-foot radius are magically transported to a random location determined with a d100 roll: 1-60 a random location on the specified plane; 61-100 a random plane of existence.

name: Amulet of the Pleasing Bouquet
crafting_components: Flower potpourri with petals taken from wedding bouquets and flowers laid at gravestones
description:
Various schools of magic employ all manner of particularly foul-smelling and noxious substances, nauseating some would-be wizards to the point of illness. These enchanted amulets were created to guard against the various stenches found in their masters' laboratories and supply closets. Enterprising apprentices quickly saw the value of peddling the enchanted trinkets to the affluent wishing to avoid the stench of the streets however, and now they are commonplace among nobility.

The most typical of these amulets look like pomanders though dozens of different styles, varieties, and scents are available for sale. While wearing it, you can spend an action and expend 1 charge from the amulet to fill your nostrils with pleasing scents for 1 hour. These scents are chosen by the amulet's creator at the time of its crafting. In more extreme circumstances like a *stinking cloud* spell or troglodyte's stench, you can expend 3 charges as a reaction to gain advantage on saving throws against the dangerous smell until the end of your next turn.

The amulet has 3 charges and regains 1d3 charges each dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 5 or less, the amulet loses its magic and becomes a mundane item.

name: Angel Eyes
crafting_components: Glass tempered in a Celestial Plane
description: Both the frame and lenses of these magnificent spectacles are made of the finest crystal. While you are wearing and attuned to the spectacles, you are immune to mental stress effects that would result from a visual encounter, you have advantage on saving throws against sight-based fear effects, and you are immune to gaze attacks.

name: Animated Shield
crafting_components: Marilith swords, or a scroll of animate objects
description: As a bonus action, you can verbally command the shield to animate and float in your space, or to stop doing so. The shield continues to act as if you were wearing it but doesn't require the use of a hand. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, or until you are incapacitated or die. It then returns to your free hand, if you have one, or else it falls to the ground. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

name: Anthology of Enhanced Radiance
crafting_components: Assorted vegetables, bound book, bed pillow
description: This slightly enchanted book holds lessons for how to look healthier. When you spend 1 hour reading and memorizing the book's lessons, after your next long rest for the following 24 hours you appear as if you've slept and eaten well for months. At the end of the duration, the effect ends and you are unable to benefit from this book until 28 days have passed.

name: Apparatus of the Crab
description:
This ingeniously crafted item (known by some as the crabaratus) is a tightly shut 500 pound iron barrel. Making a DC 20 Investigation check reveals a hidden catch which unlocks one end of the barrel-a hatch. Two Medium or smaller creatures can crawl inside where there are 10 levers in a row at the far end. Each lever is in a neutral position but can move up or down. Use of these levers makes the barrel reconfigure to resemble a giant metal crab. This item is a Large object with the following statistics:

**Armor Class**: 20
**Hit Points**: 200
**Speed**: 30 ft., swim 30 ft. (both are 0 ft. without legs and tail extended)
**Damage Immunities**: poison, psychic

The item requires a pilot to be used as a vehicle. The apparatus is airtight and watertight, and holds 10 hours worth of breathable air for a single creature, or 10 divided by the number of breathing creatures inside.

The apparatus can float or dive underwater down to 900 feet, taking 2d6 bludgeoning damage at the end of each minute spent at a lower depth.

Any creature inside the apparatus can use an action to position one or two of the levers either up or down, with the lever returning to its neutral position upon use. From left to right, the Apparatus of the Crab table shows how each lever functions.

name: Archaic Creed
crafting_components: Confession of an act of callous cruelty
description:
This crumpled vellum scroll is scrawled with an Infernal statement outlining the beliefs of a specific yet unnamed fiend. Whether or not you can read the language, while studying the statement you gain an expertise die on a Religion check made to recall or learn information about fiends. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

By repeatedly reciting the creed aloud as an action each round for 1 minute, you can cast *find familiar*, except your familiar takes the form of either an imp or a quasit. The creed is irrevocably absorbed into the familiar's body and is completely destroyed when the familiar drops to 0 hit points.

**Curse**. The familiar summoned by the creed is cursed. The fiend who wrote the creed can observe you through the summoned familiar, and can command the familiar to take actions while you are asleep or unconscious.

name: Armor +1, +2, or +3
crafting_components: Uncommon: hide or scales of a beast of CR 1-4 (like an ankheg)
Rare: special metal (adamantine, mithral, etc) or the hide or scales of a beast of CR 5-10 (like a bulette) with a high natural armor
Very Rare: raw unworked precious metal (gold or platinum) or the hide or scales of a creature of CR 11-16 (like a remorhaz) with a high natural armor
Legendary: magic armor that has fended off an attack by a legendary monster of CR 17+, or the hide or scales of a creature CR 17+
description: Wearing this armor gives an additional magic boost to AC as well as the base AC the armor provides. Its rarity and value are listed below.

name: Armor of Invulnerability
crafting_components: Scales from an ancient dragon turtle's shell
description: This armor grants you resistance to nonmagical damage. Once between long rests, you can use an action to become immune to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you remove the armor.

name: Armor of Resistance
crafting_components: Lump of elemental matter corresponding to the energy resisted (air for lightning or thunder, astral for psychic, earth for acid, ethereal for force, fire for fire, lower planes for necrotic, shadow for poison, upper planes for radiant, or water for cold)
description: This armor grants you resistance to one type of damage. The type of damage is determined when the armor is created, from the following list: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, thunder. A suit of light or medium armor of resistance is rare, and a heavy suit is very rare.

name: Armor of Vulnerability
crafting_components: Fool's gold and rust left over from a rust monster's attack
description:
This armor grants you resistance to one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. The type of damage is determined when the armor is created.

**Cursed**. Once attuned to this armor, you are cursed until you are targeted by *remove curse* or similar magic; removing the armor does not end this curse. While cursed, you have vulnerability to the other two damage types this armor does not protect against.

name: Arrow-Catching Shield
crafting_components: Wood from the winning bulls-eye target from a prestigious archery tournament
description: This shield grants you **+2** to AC against ranged attacks, in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. In addition, whenever a target within 5 feet of you is targeted by a ranged attack, you can use your reaction to make yourself the target of the attack.

name: Arrow of Slaying
crafting_components: Piece of flint from a stream in primeval forest
description:
A particular kind of creature is chosen when this magic arrow is created. When the arrow of slaying damages a creature belonging to the chosen type, heritage, or group, the creature makes a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Once the arrow of slaying deals this extra damage, it loses its magical properties.

Other types of magic ammunition exist besides arrows.

name: Assassin's Ring
crafting_components: Gemstone worn by an assassination victim at the time of their death
description:
This unassuming-looking signet ring comes with sinister features. The first is a four-chambered extradimensional space, each of which can hold one dose of poison. While wearing the ring, you can use an action to press part of its filigree to deploy one of the poisons and apply it to a weapon or piece of ammunition. You have advantage on checks made to conceal this action from observers.

In addition, you can use a bonus action to whisper a command word that makes a garrote of shadowy force unspool from the ring. A creature grappled using this garrote has disadvantage on saving throws made to escape the grapple.

This ring's magic is subtle and creatures have disadvantage on checks made to notice it is magical or determine its purpose.

name: Assembling Armor
crafting_components: Plates from a damaged suit of armor that saved its wearer from a mortal blow
description:
This thick leather belt pouch jingles softly as if filled with metal rings. This item has 6 charges and regains 1d4 each dawn.

You can use an action to speak one of three command words and expend 1 or more of the pouch's charges, causing metal rings and plates to stream out of the pouch and assemble into a suit of armor on your body.

- **Leather brigandine** (1 charge)
- **Half plate** (2 charges)
- **Full plate** (3 charges)

Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to speak a fourth command word and expend 1 charge to summon a medium shield from the pouch.

If you are already wearing armor that provides equal or greater protection than the armor provided by the pouch, the charges are wasted and nothing happens. If you are wearing armor that provides less protection, the assembling armor reinforces the armor you are already wearing and you benefit from the same level of protection as if you activated the pouch while unarmored. The armor remains on your person for up to 1 hour or until you use an action to dismiss it, after which it disassembles and returns to the pouch.

name: Atlas to Libation
description:
This golden-brown parchment has an odd handle-like wooden stave and a seal marked with an ale tankard. As a bonus action, you can break the seal and unfurl the map. When you do so, the map fills in with accurate topography in a 1-mile radius around you. A miniature image of you appears at the map's center along with a dotted line leading to an X that marks the nearest potable alcohol. The map immediately rolls back up if brought within 50 feet of alcohol or if no alcohol is within 1 mile when the seal is opened.

Once used in this way, the seal reforms and is usable again after 24 hours.

Alternatively, you can form a cylinder with the map and grasp it by the handle as an action. If you do so, the map hardens into a tall wooden tankard and magically fills with high quality ale, then loses all magical properties and becomes a mundane object.

name: Badge of Seasons
crafting_components: An annual flower bloomed in each of the 4 seasons
description:
Glowing, magical symbols of spring, summer, autumn, and winter decorate this wooden badge. So long as at least one of the symbols remains on the badge, fey creatures regard you as a figure of authority. You gain an expertise die on Intimidation and Persuasion checks made to influence fey.

Whenever you create your pact weapon, you can choose to imbue it with the magic of one of the badge's four symbols. For the next minute or until your pact weapon disappears, you gain a benefit related to the chosen symbol:

**Spring**: Whenever you use your pact weapon to damage a creature, you regain 1d4 hit points.

**Summer**: Attacks made with your pact weapon deal an additional 1d6 fire damage.

**Autumn**: Whenever you use your pact weapon to damage a creature, the target makes a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or it deals half damage with weapon attacks until the end of your next turn.

**Winter**: You can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Creatures within 5 feet of the space you left each take 1d4 cold damage.

The symbol disappears after its effect ends. Once you've used all four symbols, the badge becomes a mundane item.

name: Bag of Beans
crafting_components: Dry beans and something stolen from the sack of a cloud giant
description:
This cloth bag contains 3d4 dry beans and weighs 1/2 pound plus 1/4 pound for each bean inside.

Pouring the bag's contents on the ground creates a fiery 10-foot radius explosion. The fire ignites unattended flammable objects. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d4 fire damage on a failure, or half damage on a success.

You may also take a bean from the bag and plant it in dirt or sand and water it, producing an effect 1 minute later centered on the location where it was planted.

To determine the effect the Narrator may create something entirely new, choose one from Table: Bag of Beans, or roll.

name: Bag of Cheese
crafting_components: Piece of cheese taken from a mouse trap baited with it for at least 24 hours
description:
This item is a yellow bag with the word 'cheese' embroidered on it (in Common). Any food you put in this bag becomes cheese, but retains its original taste and condition-a moldy and dirty loaf of bread becomes a moldy and dirty piece of cheese. Any non-food items develop a distinctly cheesy aroma.

Alternatively, you can turn the bag inside out, transforming it into 1 Supply worth of any type of mundane cheese.

name: Bag of Devouring
description:
This item is actually an aperture for the mouth of an immense extradimensional creature and is often mistaken for a bag of holding.

The creature can perceive everything placed inside the bag. Up to a cubic foot of inanimate objects can be stored inside, however once per day the creature swallows any inanimate objects inside and spews them into another plane of existence (with the Narrator deciding the plane and time of day). Animal or vegetable matter placed completely inside is instead ingested and destroyed.

When part of a creature is inside the bag (including a creature reaching a hand inside) there is a 50% chance the bag pulls it inside. A creature that ends its turn inside the bag is ingested and destroyed.

A creature inside the bag can try to escape by using an action and making a DC 15 Strength check. Creatures outside the bag can use an action to attempt to reach in and pull a creature out with a DC 20 Strength check. Would-be rescuers are subject to the same 50% chance to be pulled inside.

Piercing or tearing the item destroys it, with anything currently inside shifted to a random location on the Astral Plane. Turning the bag inside out closes the mouth.

name: Bag of Holding
description:
This bag's interior space is larger than its apparent size of roughly 2 feet wide and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds and has an internal volume of 64 cubic feet. No matter what it contains, it weighs 15 pounds. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action. If you have never interacted with a specific bag of holding before, the first time you use it, it requires 1d4 rounds to take stock of its contents before anything can be retrieved from the bag.

Food or water placed in the bag immediately and permanently lose all nourishing qualities-after being in the bag, water no longer slakes thirst and food does not sate hunger or nourish. In a similar fashion, the body of a dead creature placed in the bag cannot be restored to life by *revivify*, *raise dead*, or other similar magic. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive for up to 2d4 minutes divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

The bag cannot hold any item that would not fit in a normal bag of its apparent size or any item with the Bulky quality.

If the bag is punctured, torn, or otherwise structurally damaged, it ruptures and is destroyed, and the contents are scattered throughout the Astral Plane.

Placing a bag of holding inside another extradimensional storage device such as a portable hole or handy haversack results in planar rift that destroys both items and pulls everything within 10 feet into the Astral Plane. The rift then closes and disappears.

name: Bag of Tricks
crafting_components: Ball of shed chimera fur or a molted owlbear feather
description:
This seemingly empty cloth bag comes in several colors and has a small, furry sphere inside.

You can use an action to pull the sphere from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. Upon landing, it becomes a creature determined by a roll on the Bag of Tricks table (depending on the bag's color).

The resulting creature is friendly to you and any companions you have. It acts on your turn, during which you can use a bonus action to give it simple commands such as 'attack that creature' or 'move over there'.

If the creature dies or if you use the bag again, the creature disappears without a trace. After the first use each day, there is a 50% chance that a creature from the bag is hostile instead of friendly and obedient.

Once you have used the bag three times, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

name: Barbed Devil's Bracelet
description:
The hand on which you wear this bracelet transforms into a claw covered with a dozen wicked spines. Your unarmed attacks with the claw deal 1d6 piercing damage, and you gain an expertise die on Sleight of Hand checks made to steal small items. Your hand returns to normal if you remove the bracelet.

As an action, you can draw upon the claw's magic to cast *produce flame*. Whenever you use the claw in this way, one of the bracelet's spines disappears and your hit point maximum is reduced by 1d8. This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest. If this effect reduces your hit point maximum to 0, you die and your body permanently transforms into a barbed devil. When the bracelet has no more spines it becomes a mundane item.

name: Barrow Bread
crafting_components: Rock salt licked by a basilisk
description: Barrow bread is made from mashing together plantains and starches that are grown in tropical barrows. While this viscous, starchy paste is not actually a bread, it perfectly preserves and maintains the temperature of any food tucked inside it for up to a week, protecting and preserving 1 Supply. The magic is contained in the plantain leaves that are wrapped around the barrow bread. Once unwrapped, the barrow bread itself can be consumed (as 1 Supply) within 15 minutes before the outside elements spoil it.

name: Bead of Force
crafting_components: Dust from the Astral Plane or a pocket dimension
description:
This 3/4-inch diameter sphere of black glass can be thrown up to 60 feet as an action. On impact it creates an explosion in a 10-foot radius area centered on the bead. Creatures in the area make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d4 force damage on a failure. A sphere of force then surrounds the same area for 1 minute. Any creature that is completely in the area is trapped inside the sphere if it failed its saving throw. Otherwise, it is pushed away from the point of impact until it is outside the sphere.

The wall of the sphere only allows air to pass, stopping all other attacks and effects. A creature inside the sphere can use its action to push against the sides of the sphere, moving up to half its Speed. The sphere only weighs 1 pound if lifted, regardless of the weight of the creatures inside.

name: Bead of Tracking
crafting_components: Hide of an insect from the Dreaming
description: This miniature bead is covered with hundreds of small hooks. When you use an action to place it on a creature's clothing or hide, the bead hangs there imperceptibly and creates a bond between you and the creature. You gain an expertise die on checks made to track the creature while the bead remains on it. To place the bead during combat without being noticed, you must succeed on a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check against the creature's maneuver DC (or when outside of combat, the creature's passive Perception).

name: Bejeweled Cravat
crafting_components: Gem dust from a crushed gem worth at least 50 gp
description: This ornate cravat is adorned with sparkling gem dust that catches the light. While wearing it, you gain an expertise die on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to influence creatures of the opposite gender. Once you have used this property, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
crafting_components: Lock of hair from a dwarf's beard, freely given in friendship
description:
While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

- Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.
- Advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to influence dwarves.
- Advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.
- Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
- The ability to speak, read, sign, and write Dwarvish.

In addition, while you are attuned to this belt there is a 50% chance at dawn each day that you grow a full beard (or a noticeably thicker beard if you have one already).

name: Belt of Giant Strength
crafting_components: Braided rope made of hair from the same kind of giant as the belt to be made
description:
Wearing this belt increases your Strength score to the score granted by the belt. It has no effect if your Strength is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

Each variety of belt corresponds with a different kind of giant.

**Hill giant**: Strength 20, Rare, 4000 gp
**Frost or stone giant**: Strength 23, Very Rare, 9000 gp
**Fire giant**: Strength 25, Very Rare, 20000 gp
**Cloud giant**: Strength 27, Legendary, 55000 gp
**Storm giant**: Strength 29, Legendary, 150000 gp

name: Berserker Axe
crafting_components: Haft of oak smoothed by the hands of a berserker
description:
This axe grants you a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, while you are attuned to this axe, your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained.

**Curse**. This axe is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the axe, keeping it within reach at all times. When you are not in a frenzied state, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw whenever you take damage to avoid going into a berserk rage. While in this rage, you attack the nearest creature you can see, friend or foe, until you are incapacitated or there are no creatures within 60 feet of you. The rage lasts for 1 minute, and you can end it early by succeeding on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw as an action.

name: Blade of the Arcanist
description:
This sword grants you a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you are attuned to this blade, you can use it as a spellcasting focus. When you cast a spell that requires a material component, you can ignore that component if its cost is 50 gp or less.

As an action, you can expend a spell slot to charge the blade with arcane energy for 1 minute. During this time, the blade deals an additional 1d6 force damage per level of the spell slot expended on a hit.

name: Blasting Powder
description: This small pouch contains enough black powder for one use. As an action, you can throw the pouch up to 20 feet, where it explodes on impact in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

name: Blazon of Courage
crafting_components: Banner flown in a victorious battle
description: This small, embroidered patch depicts a lion rampant. While wearing it, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. In addition, you can use an action to touch the blazon and speak its command word, causing it to emit a rallying aura for 1 minute. Allies within 10 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Bloodthirsty Blade
description:
This sword grants you a **+2** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this blade, you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt, up to a maximum of 10 hit points per hit.

**Curse**. Each time you regain hit points using this blade, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become bloodthirsty, attacking the nearest living creature (friend or foe) until it is incapacitated or you are. This state lasts for 1 minute, and you can attempt to end it early by succeeding on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw as an action.

name: Bloodthirsty Weapon
crafting_components: Iron tempered in the blood of a sacrificial creature
description: This weapon grants a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the creature's hit point maximum (rounded down, minimum 1). These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

name: Boots of Elvenkind
crafting_components: Leather from a creature native to the Feywild
description: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

name: Boots of Speed
description:
While you wear these boots, you can use a bonus action and click the boots' heels together to double your walking speed for 10 minutes. This bonus applies to any form of movement that relies on your walking speed. The boots can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

When the effect ends, you can't move faster than your normal walking speed until you finish a short or long rest.

name: Boots of the Winterlands
description:
These fur-lined boots grant the following benefits while you wear them:

- You can move across difficult terrain made of ice or snow without expending extra movement.
- You have resistance to cold damage.
- You can tolerate temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection. If you wear heavy clothes, you can tolerate temperatures as low as -100 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Bracers of Archery
description: While you wear these bracers, you gain proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a **+2** bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

name: Bracers of Defense
description: While you wear these bracers and are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + 2.

name: Brooch of Shielding
crafting_components: Fragment of a shattered force barrier
description: While wearing this brooch, you have resistance to force damage, and you have immunity to damage from the *magic missile* spell.

name: Broom of Flying
description:
This wooden broom weighs 3 pounds and functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds, but its speed is reduced to 30 feet if carrying more than 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

name: Candle of Invocation
description:
This slender taper is dedicated to a specific deity and shares that deity's alignment. While the candle is lit, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Any creature within this light that shares the candle's alignment and can cast spells gains a **+2** bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. In addition, spells cast by such creatures that restore hit points or deal radiant damage have their effects maximized.

The candle burns for 4 hours total, and its magic is lost if it is extinguished or when its burning time is spent. Lighting the candle requires an action, and it can be lit only by a creature that shares its alignment.

name: Cape of the Mountebank
crafting_components: Thread spun by a phase spider
description: This cape smells faintly of brimstone. While wearing it, you can use an action to cast the *dimension door* spell. When you do, you leave behind a cloud of smoke, and you appear in a similar cloud at your destination. The smoke lightly obscures the spaces you left and arrived in. This property of the cape can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Carpet of Flying
description:
You can speak the carpet's command word as an action to make it hover and fly. It moves according to your spoken directions, provided you are within 30 feet of it. The carpet comes in four sizes, each with its own carrying capacity and flying speed:

- **3 ft. x 5 ft.**: 200 pounds, 80 feet (cost 6000 gp)
- **4 ft. x 6 ft.**: 400 pounds, 60 feet (cost 8000 gp)
- **5 ft. x 7 ft.**: 600 pounds, 40 feet (cost 10000 gp)
- **6 ft. x 9 ft.**: 800 pounds, 30 feet (cost 17000 gp)

A carpet can carry up to twice its listed capacity, but its flying speed becomes 5 feet while carrying more than its normal capacity.

name: Cauldron of Plenty
description: This iron cauldron is engraved with runes of abundance. Once per day, when you speak its command word, the cauldron fills with enough hearty stew to feed up to 12 Medium creatures (or an equivalent number of smaller or larger creatures). The stew remains hot and fresh for 24 hours or until the cauldron is used again. Eating a bowl of this stew counts as 1 Supply and grants 5 temporary hit points that last for 8 hours.

name: Censer of Controlling Air Elementals
crafting_components: Incense blessed by an air elemental
description: While incense is burning in this censer, you can use an action to speak the censer's command word and summon an air elemental, as if you had cast the *conjure elemental* spell. The censer can't be used this way again until the next dawn. The censer weighs 1 pound.

name: Chime of Opening
crafting_components: Bell rung during a thieves' guild initiation
description: This hollow metal tube is 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. You can strike it as an action, pointing it at an object within 120 feet that can be opened, such as a door, lid, or lock. The chime issues a clear tone, and one lock or latch on the object opens unless the sound can't reach the object or it is magically sealed. If the object is barred, the bar is pushed aside. The chime has 10 charges. Each use expends 1 charge, and when the last charge is used, the chime crumbles into dust.

name: Circlet of Blasting
description: While wearing this circlet, you can use an action to cast the *scorching ray* spell with it, using a spell attack bonus of **+5**. The circlet can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Cloak of Arachnida
description:
This fine black cloak is adorned with a web-like pattern. While you wear it, you gain the following benefits:

- You have resistance to poison damage.
- You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and ceilings while leaving your hands free, as if under the effects of the *spider climb* spell.
- You can cast the *web* spell (save DC 15) once per day without expending a spell slot or material components. The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Cloak of Displacement
description: While you wear this cloak, it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitated, blinded, or otherwise deprived of sight.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind
description: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to blend into its surroundings. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Cloak of Protection
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

name: Cloak of the Bat
crafting_components: Wing membrane of a giant bat
description:
While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. In an area of dim light or darkness, you can grip the edges of the cloak with both hands and use it to fly at a speed of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak with both hands while flying, you immediately fall unless you have another means of staying aloft.

Additionally, while in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use an action to cast the *polymorph* spell on yourself, transforming into a bat. While in bat form, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, and you can't speak or cast spells. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
description: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you can breathe underwater, and you have a swimming speed of 60 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Crystal Ball
crafting_components: Crystal mined from the Astral Plane
description:
This crystal sphere is 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the *scrying* spell (save DC 17) with it. The crystal ball can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Some crystal balls have additional properties, such as allowing you to cast *clairvoyance* or *arcane eye* once per day, as determined by the Narrator.

name: Cube of Force
description:
This cube is 1 inch across and has 36 charges. You can use an action to press one of the cube's faces, expending a number of charges based on the chosen effect, as shown in the Cube of Force Effects table. Each effect creates a barrier centered on you, extending 10 feet in all directions, that lasts until you use another face, you are incapacitated, or the cube runs out of charges.

**Cube of Force Effects**:
- **1 charge**: Gases, wind, and fog can't pass through.
- **2 charges**: Nonliving matter can't pass through.
- **3 charges**: Living matter can't pass through.
- **4 charges**: Spell effects can't pass through.
- **5 charges**: Nothing can pass through, and the barrier is immune to all damage.

The cube regains 1d20 charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the cube loses its magic and becomes a mundane item.

name: Cubic Gate
crafting_components: Gem from each of six planes
description: This cube is 3 inches across, with each face carved with a distinct rune representing a different plane of existence. You can use an action to press one face and cast the *plane shift* spell, transporting you and up to eight willing creatures to the plane associated with that face, or to a random location in the Material Plane if the Material Plane face is pressed. Each face can be used once, and the cube can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Daern's Instant Fortress
description:
This metal cube is 1 inch across. You can use an action to place it on the ground and speak its command word, causing it to expand into a 20-foot-square, 30-foot-high tower made of adamantine. The tower has a single entrance, a 10-foot-square door, and arrow slits on each level. It has an AC of 20, 200 hit points, and immunity to nonmagical damage.

The tower remains until you use an action to speak the command word again, causing it to collapse back into a cube, provided no creatures are inside. If the tower takes damage, it regains 10 hit points daily at dawn.

name: Dagger of Venom
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this dagger. As an action, you can cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until you hit a creature with the dagger. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Dancing Sword
crafting_components: Blade tempered by a bard's song
description: You gain a **+2** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. You can use a bonus action to toss this sword into the air and speak its command word. It then flies up to 30 feet and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of it, using your attack roll and ability modifiers. The sword continues to attack each round on your turn, moving up to 30 feet to attack a creature you designate. You can use a bonus action to command it to return to your hand. The sword falls if you become incapacitated or die. You can't use this property again until the next dawn.

name: Decanter of Endless Water
crafting_components: Vial of water from an elemental plane
description:
This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words, causing water to pour out:

- **Stream**: Produces 1 gallon of water per round.
- **Fountain**: Produces 5 gallons of water per round.
- **Geyser**: Produces 30 gallons of water per round, or a 30-foot-long, 1-foot-wide stream that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage to any creature in its path (DC 13 Strength saving throw to avoid).

The water stops pouring when you use an action to speak the command word again or replace the stopper.

name: Deck of Illusions
description: This deck contains 34 cards made of painted parchment. When you draw a card and throw it to the ground (an action), it creates an illusion of a creature or object, as determined by the card drawn. The illusion lasts for 1 hour or until it takes damage, and it appears real to all senses except touch. Creatures can move through it, revealing its illusory nature. The deck can't be used again until the next dawn, and any cards drawn are removed from the deck permanently.

name: Deck of Many Things
crafting_components: Parchment blessed by a deity of fate
description: This deck contains 22 cards, each with a powerful magical effect. Before you draw a card, you must declare how many cards you intend to draw, and then draw them randomly. Each card's effect is resolved immediately, and the card disappears after use. Drawing a card requires an action. The effects are determined by the Narrator, and can range from gaining immense wealth or power to catastrophic consequences, such as losing all possessions or being imprisoned in another plane.

name: Defender
crafting_components: Blade tempered in the blood of a dragon
description: You gain a **+3** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. The first time you attack with the sword on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the sword's bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn, instead of using it for attack and damage rolls. For example, you could reduce the bonus to attack and damage rolls to **+1** and gain a **+2** bonus to AC.

name: Demon Armor
description:
While wearing this armor, you gain a **+1** bonus to AC, and you can understand and speak Abyssal. In addition, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and they are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

**Curse**. Once you don this armor, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a *remove curse* spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws against demons, and you are compelled to obey the commands of any demon that speaks to you in Abyssal.

name: Dimensional Shackles
description: You can use an action to place these shackles on an incapacitated creature. The shackles adjust to fit any creature from Small to Large. In addition to serving as mundane manacles, the shackles prevent the creature from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to another plane. The creature can escape with a DC 20 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check or a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check. The shackles have AC 19 and 20 hit points.

name: Dragon Scale Mail
description:
This armor consists of dragon scales woven onto a leather backing. While wearing it, you gain a **+1** bonus to AC, and you have advantage on saving throws against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons. You also have resistance to one type of damage associated with the dragon whose scales were used to create the armor (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison).

Additionally, you can focus your senses as an action to magically discern the distance and direction to the closest dragon within 30 miles that matches the type of the armor’s scales. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Dragon Slayer
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 damage of the weapon’s type. For the purpose of this weapon, 'dragon' refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.

name: Driftglobe
description: This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. You can speak its command word as an action to cause it to emit bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or to cast the *daylight* spell (60-foot radius) or the *levitate* spell (targeting only itself) once per day. The light lasts until you speak the command word again or until 10 minutes have passed for the *daylight* spell. The globe hovers when under the effect of *levitate* and moves as you direct, up to 20 feet per round.

name: Dust of Disappearance
description: This small packet contains 1d4 pinches of dust. You can use an action to throw a pinch of the dust into the air, creating a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you that grants the effects of the *invisibility* spell to all creatures within it. The cloud lasts for 2d4 minutes or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Each pinch used is consumed.

name: Dust of Dryness
description:
This small packet contains 1d4 pinches of dust. You can use an action to throw a pinch of the dust onto a body of water up to 15 cubic feet (about 100 gallons). The water is instantly transformed into a small, marble-sized pellet that weighs 1 ounce. You can use an action to crush the pellet, releasing the water in its original form.

If thrown at a creature made of water (such as a water elemental), the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and be restrained until the end of its next turn. Each pinch used is consumed.

name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
description:
This small packet contains 1d4 pinches of dust. You can use an action to throw a pinch of the dust into the air, creating a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 minute, coughing and sneezing uncontrollably. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed disperses it.

**Curse**. The dust affects you as well unless you succeed on the saving throw, and the packet doesn't indicate its true nature until used.

name: Dwarven Thrower
crafting_components: Mithral forged in a dwarven forge
description: You gain a **+3** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this warhammer. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage, or 2d8 bludgeoning damage if the target is a giant. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

name: Efreeti Bottle
crafting_components: Brass from the City of Brass
description:
This ornate bottle is sealed with a stopper bearing a fiery rune. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of smoke emerges, and an efreeti appears. Roll a d100 to determine the efreeti’s disposition:

- **1-10**: The efreeti is hostile and attacks immediately.
- **11-90**: The efreeti grants you three wishes, as per the *wish* spell, but interprets them in the most malicious way possible before departing.
- **91-100**: The efreeti serves you loyally for 1 hour before departing.

Once the efreeti departs, the bottle becomes a nonmagical item.

name: Elemental Gem
description:
This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an action to break the gem, an elemental is summoned as if you had cast the *conjure elemental* spell (no concentration required), and the gem is destroyed. The type of elemental depends on the gem:

- **Blue Sapphire**: Air elemental
- **Red Corundum**: Fire elemental
- **Emerald**: Earth elemental
- **Diamond**: Water elemental

name: Eversmoking Bottle
description: This metal bottle has a stopper engraved with smoky runes. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke pours out, filling a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the bottle. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The smoke lasts for 1 hour or until a wind of moderate or greater speed disperses it. You can use an action to replace the stopper, stopping the flow of smoke. The bottle can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Eyes of Charming
description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can cast the *charm person* spell (save DC 13) as an action, targeting a humanoid within 30 feet. The lenses have 3 charges and regain 1d3 charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the lenses crumble into dust and are destroyed.

name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
crafting_components: Lenses ground by a gnome artisan
description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you can see fine details clearly, granting advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight to examine small objects or fine details, such as searching for traps or hidden mechanisms.

name: Eyes of the Eagle
description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can see details of objects up to 1 mile away as if they were only 100 feet away.

name: Figurine of Wondrous Power
crafting_components: Carved stone blessed by a druid
description: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. When you use an action to speak its command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet, it becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied, the figurine doesn't activate. The creature is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. It reverts to a figurine after a specified duration or when it drops to 0 hit points. Each figurine has a unique duration and recharge time, as determined by its type (e.g., Bronze Griffon, Ebony Fly, Golden Lions, etc.).

name: Flame Tongue
description: You can use a bonus action to speak this sword’s command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage on a hit. You can use a bonus action to douse the flames.

name: Folding Boat
description:
This object appears as a wooden box that measures 12 inches long, 6 inches wide, and 6 inches deep. It weighs 4 pounds and floats on water. You can use an action to speak one of three command words to transform it into one of the following forms, each with its own statistics:

- **Small Boat**: 10 feet long, 4 feet wide, carries 4 Medium creatures, AC 11, 50 hit points.
- **Large Boat**: 24 feet long, 8 feet wide, carries 6 Medium creatures and cargo, AC 11, 100 hit points.
- **Rowboat**: 12 feet long, 5 feet wide, carries 2 Medium creatures, AC 11, 25 hit points.

Speaking the appropriate command word again returns it to its box form, provided no creatures are inside.

name: Frost Brand
description: When you draw this sword, it sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. While attuned to it, you have resistance to fire damage. In freezing temperatures, the blade deals an extra 1d6 cold damage on a hit. You can use a bonus action to cause the blade to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, or to extinguish the light.

name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
description: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher.

name: Gem of Brightness
description:
This prism has 50 charges and can produce three effects:

- **Light**: As an action, you cause the gem to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This effect lasts until you use an action to end it (no charge cost).
- **Flash**: As an action, you expend 1 charge to cause the gem to emit a blinding flash in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
- **Beam**: As an action, you expend 5 charges to fire a 60-foot line of radiant energy. Each creature in the line must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d8 radiant damage.

If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the gem burns out and becomes nonmagical.

name: Gem of Seeing
description: This gem has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to gain the ability to see through illusions, invisibility, and other deceptive magic for 10 minutes, as if under the effects of the *true seeing* spell. The gem regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

name: Giant Slayer
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra 2d6 damage of the weapon’s type and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. For the purpose of this weapon, 'giant' refers to any creature with the giant type, including ettins and trolls.

name: Glamoured Studded Leather
description: While wearing this armor, you gain a **+1** bonus to AC. You can also use a bonus action to speak the armor’s command word and cause it to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the armor.

name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
description: While wearing these gloves, whenever you are targeted by a ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier. If you reduce the damage to 0, you catch the missile if it is small enough to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free.

name: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
description: While wearing these gloves, you gain a climbing speed and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb or swim.

name: Goggles of Night
description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

name: Hammer of Thunderbolts
crafting_components: Iron forged in a storm giant’s forge
description:
You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this maul. When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra 3d10 bludgeoning damage, and you can choose to release a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet. Each creature within 30 feet of the target (including you) must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

If you are wearing a *Belt of Giant Strength* and *Gauntlets of Ogre Power* while attuned to this maul, your Strength score increases to 25, and you can use the maul’s thunderous boom property without expending charges. Otherwise, the maul has 5 charges, regains 1d4+1 charges daily at dawn, and expends 1 charge per use of the thunderous boom.

name: Handy Haversack
description:
This backpack has a central pouch and two side pouches, each of which is an extradimensional space. The central pouch can hold up to 80 pounds of material or 8 cubic feet, while each side pouch can hold up to 20 pounds or 2 cubic feet. The haversack always weighs 5 pounds, regardless of its contents.

Retrieving an item from the haversack requires an action, but the item you desire is always magically at the top. Placing the haversack inside another extradimensional space, such as a *bag of holding*, creates a rift that destroys both items and pulls everything within 10 feet into the Astral Plane.

name: Hat of Disguise
description: While wearing this hat, you can use an action to cast the *disguise self* spell at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

name: Headband of Intellect
description: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you wear this headband. It has no effect on you if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher.

name: Helm of Brilliance
description:
This dazzling helm is set with 10 diamonds, 20 rubies, 30 fire opals, and 40 opals, each glowing with inner light. While wearing it, you can use an action to produce one of the following effects, expending the appropriate gem:

- **Diamond**: Cast *daylight* (1 diamond).
- **Ruby**: Cast *fireball* (1 ruby, save DC 17).
- **Fire Opal**: Cast *flaming sphere* (1 fire opal, save DC 17).
- **Opal**: Shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet (1 opal, lasts until you end it as an action).

You also have resistance to fire damage while wearing the helm. If you are targeted by an effect that deals fire damage, roll a d20. On a 1, the helm emits a burst of light, dealing 10d6 fire damage to you and all creatures within 30 feet (no saving throw), and the helm and its gems are destroyed.

name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
description: While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the *comprehend languages* spell at will.

name: Helm of Telepathy
crafting_components: Crystal from a mind flayer’s lair
description: While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the *detect thoughts* spell (save DC 13) at will. You can also use an action to send a telepathic message to a creature you can see within 60 feet, and it can respond if it understands at least one language. The helm can't be used to send messages to creatures that are immune to being charmed.

name: Helm of Teleportation
description: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast the *teleport* spell, targeting yourself and up to seven willing creatures you can see within 10 feet. The helm regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

name: Holy Avenger
description:
You gain a **+3** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. When you hit a fiend or undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage.

While you hold the sword, you create an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all friendly creatures in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

name: Horn of Blasting
description: You can use an action to blow this horn, causing a thunderous blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 5d6 thunder damage and be deafened for 1 minute. A creature made of inorganic material, such as stone or metal, has disadvantage on this saving throw. The horn has a 20% chance of exploding after each use, destroying itself and dealing 10d6 fire damage to the blower.

name: Horn of Valhalla
crafting_components: Horn carved from a dragon’s bone
description:
You can use an action to blow this horn, summoning berserkers to fight for you. The type and number of berserkers depend on the horn’s material:

- **Silver (Rare, 5000 gp)**: Summons 2d4+2 berserkers (CR 2).
- **Brass (Very Rare, 10000 gp)**: Summons 3d4+3 berserkers (CR 3).
- **Bronze (Legendary, 20000 gp)**: Summons 4d4+4 berserkers (CR 4).

The berserkers appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet, are friendly to you, and fight until they die or 1 hour passes, then disappear. The horn can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

name: Horseshoes of Speed
description: When affixed to a horse or similar creature’s hooves, these horseshoes increase the creature’s walking speed by 30 feet. The creature must be willing, and affixing or removing the horseshoes takes 1 hour.

name: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
description: When affixed to a horse or similar creature’s hooves, these horseshoes allow the creature to move normally while floating 4 inches above the ground, ignoring difficult terrain and leaving no tracks. The creature must be willing, and affixing or removing the horseshoes takes 1 hour.

name: Immovable Rod
description: This flat iron rod has a button on one end. You can use an action to press the button, causing the rod to become magically fixed in place. Until you or another creature uses an action to push the button again, the rod doesn’t move, even if it is defying gravity. The rod can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes it to deactivate and fall. A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check to move the rod up to 10 feet.

name: Instant Fortress (Daern’s)
description:
This metal cube is 1 inch across. You can use an action to place it on the ground and speak its command word, causing it to expand into a 20-foot-square, 30-foot-high tower made of adamantine. The tower has a single entrance, a 10-foot-square door, and arrow slits on each level. It has an AC of 20, 200 hit points, and immunity to nonmagical damage.

The tower remains until you use an action to speak the command word again, causing it to collapse back into a cube, provided no creatures are inside. If the tower takes damage, it regains 10 hit points daily at dawn.

name: Ioun Stone
description:
This stone orbits your head at a distance of 1–3 feet when activated. Each type of stone grants a specific benefit, such as increased ability scores, spell absorption, or regeneration. The stone’s effect is active as long as it orbits you, but it can be grabbed or knocked away with a successful DC 15 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check by a creature within 5 feet. Examples include:

- **Awareness (Rare, 5000 gp)**: You can’t be surprised while conscious.
- **Protection (Rare, 5000 gp)**: **+1** bonus to AC.
- **Regeneration (Very Rare, 10000 gp)**: Regain 1 hit point per minute, up to your maximum.
- **Greater Absorption (Legendary, 20000 gp)**: Absorb a spell of 8th level or lower targeting you, ending the stone’s effect.

name: Iron Bands of Bilarro
description: This rusty iron sphere is 3 inches in diameter. You can use an action to speak its command word and throw it at a creature within 60 feet. The sphere unfolds into iron bands that wrap around the target, which must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. A restrained creature can use an action to make a DC 20 Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) to escape. The bands can be destroyed (AC 20, 25 hit points). The sphere reforms after 1 minute or when the creature escapes, and it can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Iron Bands of Binding
description: This rusty iron sphere measures 3 inches in diameter. You can use an action to speak its command word and throw it at a creature within 60 feet. The sphere expands into bands that attempt to bind the target, which must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be restrained. A restrained creature can use an action to make a DC 20 Strength or Dexterity check to escape. Speaking the command word again causes the bands to contract back into a sphere, provided no creature is restrained. The bands can be destroyed (AC 20, 60 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage).

name: Iron Flask
crafting_components: Brass from the Elemental Plane of Fire
description: This iron flask has a brass stopper. You can use an action to speak its command word and target a creature within 60 feet that is not a construct or undead. The creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be trapped inside the flask. Only one creature can be trapped at a time. Speaking the command word again releases the creature, which appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. If the creature is hostile, it attacks you immediately. The flask can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Javelin of Lightning
description: This javelin is a magic weapon. When you hurl it and speak its command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line (except you) must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The lightning bolt turns back into a javelin when it reaches the target. The javelin can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Lantern of Revealing
description: While lit, this hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they are within the bright light. You can use an action to lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

name: Luck Blade
crafting_components: Blade forged with a wish spell
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. While attuned to it, you can use an action to cast the *wish* spell from it, expending one of its 1d4–1 charges (minimum 1). If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the sword loses its wish-casting ability but retains its **+1** bonus.

name: Mace of Disruption
description: When you hit a fiend or undead with this mace, it takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn. While you hold the mace, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Mace of Smiting
description: You gain a **+1** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this mace. When you roll a 20 on the attack roll, the target takes an extra 2d6 bludgeoning damage. If the target is a construct or made of inorganic material, it takes an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

name: Mace of Terror
description: This mace has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cause a wave of terror to sweep out from you. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The mace regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells while you wear this cloak.

name: Marvelous Pigments
crafting_components: Pigments mixed with a genie's breath
description: This small pot contains 1d4 ounces of pigment. You can use an action to paint with the pigments, creating three-dimensional objects or terrain features by painting their two-dimensional representations. The objects must fit within a 10-foot cube, and you can create up to 10,000 gp worth of nonmagical objects or terrain features (such as walls, doors, or furniture). Each ounce of pigment can cover 100 square feet. The created objects last for 24 hours or until the pigment is washed away. Once used, the pigment is consumed.

name: Medallion of Thoughts
description: This medallion has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast the *detect thoughts* spell (save DC 13). The medallion regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

name: Mirror of Life Trapping
description: This 4-foot-tall mirror can trap up to 12 creatures. You can use an action to speak its command word and target a creature you can see within 30 feet. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be trapped inside one of the mirror’s cells, appearing as a miniature version of itself. A trapped creature is in stasis and doesn’t age or need sustenance. You can release a creature by speaking a second command word, causing it to appear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. If the mirror is destroyed (AC 10, 5 hit points), all trapped creatures are freed and appear within 30 feet.

name: Mithral Armor
item_type: Armor (medium or heavy, but not plate)
description: Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version doesn’t.

name: Necklace of Adaptation
description: While wearing this necklace, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases and vapors (such as *cloudkill* or a troglodyte’s stench).

name: Necklace of Fireballs
description: This necklace has 1d6+3 beads hanging from it. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet. The bead explodes on impact, functioning as a 3rd-level *fireball* spell (save DC 15). You can hurl multiple beads (up to the number of beads remaining) to increase the spell’s level by 1 per additional bead, but this requires using a higher-level spell slot equivalent. Once all beads are used, the necklace becomes nonmagical.

name: Necklace of Prayer Beads
description: This necklace has 1d4 + 2 beads, each imbued with a spell. You can use an action to activate a bead and cast its spell without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. The spells include *bless*, *cure wounds* (2nd level), *lesser restoration*, *greater restoration*, *planar ally*, or *wind walk*. Each bead can be used once per day, and the necklace regains all expended uses daily at dawn.

name: Nine Lives Stealer
description: You gain a **+2** bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword. The sword has 1d4+4 charges. When you score a critical hit against a creature with fewer than 100 hit points, you can expend 1 charge to force the creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature dies instantly as the sword steals its life force. When all charges are expended, the sword loses this property but retains its **+2** bonus.

name: Oathbow
description: When you nock an arrow on this bow, you can whisper a command word and choose one creature you can see within 120 feet as your sworn enemy. Until the target is dead or 7 days have passed, you have advantage on attack rolls against it with this bow, and your arrows deal an extra 3d6 piercing damage to it. You can’t choose a new sworn enemy until the current one is dead or the 7 days have passed. While attuned to the bow, you have disadvantage on attack rolls with other weapons.

name: Oil of Etherealness
description: This cloudy gray oil can be applied to yourself or another creature, taking 1 minute. The affected creature gains the effect of the *etherealness* spell for 1 hour, allowing it to move to or from the Ethereal Plane. One vial contains enough oil for one application.

name: Oil of Sharpness
description: This clear, gelatinous oil can be applied to one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition, taking 1 minute. For the next hour, the affected weapon or ammunition gains a **+3** bonus to attack and damage rolls. One vial contains enough oil for one weapon or 5 pieces of ammunition.

name: Oil of Slipperiness
description: This sticky black oil can be applied to yourself or another creature, taking 1 minute. The affected creature gains the effect of the *freedom of movement* spell for 8 hours. Alternatively, the oil can be poured on the ground, covering a 10-foot-square area and turning it into difficult terrain for 8 hours. One vial contains enough oil for one application or one area.

name: Pearl of Power
description: While this pearl is on your person, you can use an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot of up to 3rd level. The pearl can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Periapt of Health
description: You are immune to contracting diseases while you wear this pendant, but it has no effect on diseases already affecting you.

name: Periapt of Proof against Poison
description: You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition while you wear this pendant.

name: Periapt of Wound Closure
description: While wearing this periapt, you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, you regain the maximum number of hit points possible for that die.

name: Philter of Love
description: When you drink this potion, the first creature you see within the next 10 minutes that you find attractive becomes charmed by you for 1 hour. If the creature is of a type or alignment that you would normally find repulsive, you are instead repulsed by it for 1 hour. The potion’s rosy liquid glimmers with a faint magical aura.

name: Pipes of Haunting
description: You must be proficient with wind instruments to use these pipes. They have 3 charges. You can use an action to play them and expend 1 charge to create an eerie, spellbinding tune. Each creature within 30 feet that can hear you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. Creatures with an Intelligence of 4 or lower are unaffected. The pipes regain 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

name: Pipes of the Sewers
description: You must be proficient with wind instruments to use these pipes. While attuned, rats and giant rats within 60 feet are indifferent toward you and won’t attack unless provoked. You can use an action to play the pipes, summoning 1d4 swarms of rats if any are within 120 feet. The swarms are friendly to you and obey your commands for 1 hour or until they die. The pipes can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Plate Armor of Etherealness
crafting_components: Plate forged in the Ethereal Plane
description: While wearing this armor, you can use an action to speak its command word and gain the effect of the *etherealness* spell, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you remove the armor or speak the command word again. The armor can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Portable Hole
description: This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter. You can use an action to unfold and place the portable hole on a solid surface, whereupon the portable hole creates an extradimensional hole 10 feet deep. The cylindrical space within the hole exists on a different plane, so it can't be used to create open passages. Any creature inside an open portable hole can exit the hole by climbing out of it. You can use an action to close a portable hole by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Folding the cloth closes the hole, and any creatures or objects inside remain in the extradimensional space. No matter what's in it, the hole weighs next to nothing.
